# Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) in R

# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)  # For data visualization

# Generate a sample dataset for illustration
set.seed(123)  # Set seed for reproducibility

# Assuming we have a population with traits measured for each individual
population_size <- 100
trait_1 <- rnorm(population_size, mean = 50, sd = 10)
trait_2 <- rnorm(population_size, mean = 75, sd = 15)
trait_3 <- rnorm(population_size, mean = 60, sd = 12)

# Create a dataframe with the generated data
your_dataset <- data.frame(
  ID = 1:population_size,
  Trait_1 = trait_1,
  Trait_2 = trait_2,
  Trait_3 = trait_3
)

# Display summary statistics
cat("Summary Statistics:\n")
summary(your_dataset)

# Measures of Central Tendency
cat("\nMeasures of Central Tendency:\n")
mean_trait_1 <- mean(your_dataset$Trait_1)
median_trait_2 <- median(your_dataset$Trait_2)
mode_trait_3 <- as.numeric(names(sort(table(your_dataset$Trait_3), decreasing = TRUE)[1]))

cat("Mean Trait 1:", mean_trait_1, "\n")
cat("Median Trait 2:", median_trait_2, "\n")
cat("Mode Trait 3:", mode_trait_3, "\n")

# Measures of Variability
cat("\nMeasures of Variability:\n")
range_trait_1 <- range(your_dataset$Trait_1)
sd_trait_2 <- sd(your_dataset$Trait_2)

cat("Range Trait 1:", range_trait_1[1], "-", range_trait_1[2], "\n")
cat("Standard Deviation Trait 2:", sd_trait_2, "\n")

# Data Visualization
cat("\nData Visualization:\n")

# Create a histogram for Trait 1
ggplot(your_dataset, aes(x = Trait_1)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 5, fill = "blue", color = "black", alpha = 0.7) +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Trait 1", x = "Trait 1", y = "Frequency")

# Create a boxplot for Trait 2
ggplot(your_dataset, aes(x = "Trait 2", y = Trait_2)) +
  geom_boxplot(fill = "lightblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Boxplot of Trait 2", x = "Trait", y = "Trait 2")

# Additional Summary Statistics
cat("\nAdditional Summary Statistics:\n")

skewness_trait_1 <- moments::skewness(your_dataset$Trait_1)
kurtosis_trait_2 <- moments::kurtosis(your_dataset$Trait_2)

cat("Skewness Trait 1:", skewness_trait_1, "\n")
cat("Kurtosis Trait 2:", kurtosis_trait_2, "\n")
